repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: An incomplete copy of the Tamiḻ Aṟiyum Perumāḷ Katai.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (March 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 11 folios = Tamiḻ Aṟiyum Perumāḷ Katai: Text. Tamil foliation 2-31. 1f missing. 4 to 5 lpp. 440 x 25 mm.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation. Some folios truncated.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 416 (front cover, recto).
Arabic foliation added in black ink: 31 (f31r).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1790 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1790 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1852, since part of the collection of Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852). Described in s.n. (1854).

provenance.p: Owned by Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852). — See S.n. 1854, p. 346, no. 169.

acquisition.p: Acquired, August 2nd, 1854, from “Madame veuve Burnouf”. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 2 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1893, no. 4955.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 60, no. 416.
S.n. 1854. Catalogue des livres imprimés et manuscrits composant la bibliothèque de feu M. Eugène Burnouf. Paris: Duprat. — See p. 346, no. 169.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 95r, no. 386 416.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
